snippet: Many American students are being offered little or no physical education as schools blame budget cuts.
abstract: Biennial survey by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that many American high school students are offered little or no physical education; in New York City, where the Bloomberg administration has received high marks from public heath advocates for its anti-obesity policies, 20.5 percent of public school students reported that they had no physical education classes, compared with 14.4 percent a decade earlier.
lead_paragraph: Many American students are being offered little or no physical education as schools blame budget cuts.

headline.seo: Even as Obesity Concerns Rise, Physical Education Is Sidelined
headline.main: Despite Obesity Concerns, Gym Classes Are Cut
headline.print_headline: Gym Class Finds Itself On Sideline

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
